title: Kevin Rue-Albrecht
text:
I am a computational biologist and biomedical data science trainer at the University of Oxford, with a focus on functional genomics and single-cell sequencing.
I actively collaborate on a range of research projects, predominantly applying single-cell analysis to diverse biological questions.
Inspiration from these collaborations drives my development of research software, with a particular emphasis on interactive data visualisation.
I am also an active contributor to the Bioconductor project, where I develop and maintain R packages together with the community.

title: Software
text:
My research and development work has resulted in various software packages, primarily focused on bioinformatics and data visualization.



iSEE


Interactive SummarizedExperiment Explorer - A Bioconductor package for interactive visualization of genomics data.

iSEEindex

title: Software
text:
Other Contributions



Panpipes


A collection of cgat-core/ruffus pipelines to streamline the analysis of multi-modal single cell data. Supports scRNAseq, CITEseq, scV(D)Jseq, scATACseq, and spatial transcriptomics data with comprehensive workflows for quality control, preprocessing, integration, clustering, and visualization.


 Documentation      GitHub      Paper
